intro: Galium × alberti, commonly known as the Albert's bedstraw, is a hybrid plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium × alberti is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its growth habit and floral structure make it a common sight in moist, temperate regions of Europe.
